text: Consequences of poorly managed pain’ Organ system: Possible clinical manifestations Cardiovascular Tachycardia, hypertension, 1 systemic vascular resistance, 7 cardiac workload Pulmonary Tachypnoea, hypoxia, hypercarbia, 4 cough, ¢ VC and FRC, atelectasis, pneumonia, V/Q mismatching Gastrointestinal Anorexia, nausea, vomiting, ileus Renal Oliguria, urinary retention Neuroendocrine 1 adrenergic activity, catabolism and 1 oxygen consumption, vagal inhibition Central nervous system Anxiety, fear sedation, fatigue, depression Immunologic Impaired, especially cell-mediated immunity Musculoskeletal Reduced mobility, pressure sores, T risk of DVT's
